'''Zekr''' is an [[open source]] [[Quran]]ic desktop application. It is an open platform Quran study tool for browsing and researching on the Quran. Zekr is a Quran-based project, planned to be a ''universal'', ''open source'', and ''cross-platform'' application to perform most of the usual refers to the [[Quran]], according to the project website.<ref>[http://zekr.org/ zekr.org]</ref>
Zekr is capable of having multiple add-ons, that is different translation packs, themes, recitations and revelation packs.<ref>A list of Zekr [http://zekr.org/resources.html add-ons]</ref>
As of Zekr 0.7.0, it is possible to search through different Quran translations both with indexed ([[Lucene]]-based) search and basic search. Moreover this release introduces paging support for Quran text.
Zekr accepts different [[Plug-in (computing)|add-ons]] to make application as customizable as possible. Currently it accepts different Quraan translation packs, language packs, [[Quran revelation order|revelation order]] pack and theme packs. Revelation order packs are used to sort search results based on different revelation order schemes.
Zekr comes with an [[Nullsoft Scriptable Install System|NSIS]] installer for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and an [[Application bundle]] for [[Mac OS|Mac]]. There is always a base <tt>.tar.gz</tt> package for (all) Linux machines as well as [[Debian package]]s for Debian-compliant Linux distributions.
Recitations and translations are available for download in [http://zekr.org/resources.html here] <!-- == What does Zekr mean ==
